ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_rainbow] Who's that?
ygData.msgSnippet: WOW! Glad you came to join us Clayton! You ll find most of us are a bit strange (gay gamer geeks, what more do you need to know?), some of us are rude,
ygData.messageBody:
WOW!
Glad you came to join us Clayton!
You'll find most of us are a bit strange (gay gamer geeks, what more do
you need to know?), some of us are rude, obnoxious, pushy and egotistical
(/em looks around to see all the fingers pointing at him) but most of all,
we are already a little family!
You have one of my dream jobs. I am a writer myself. I would love to
be doing what you are doing! Part of the fun of this game for me is
figuring out the story lines and talking to the npcs. My writing is mostly
a hobby right now, but I have had minor things published here and there. I
hope one day to not be stuck doing this dreadful 8 to 5 job type thing
really.
I am glad there are a few gay people working at/for Verant and are open
about it. Sony as a company completely disappoints me continuously, but VI
seems to be pretty cool.
Anyway enough rambling - you should probably join the Rodcet guild list
by sending a blank email to:
rodcet-subscribe@...

Jai

Hamyrmint Forgewell
27th Level Cleric of Kaladim

----- Original Message -----
From: "Clayton Kroh" <ckroh@...>
To: <EQ_rainbow@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, September 04, 2000 8:28 PM
Subject: [EQ_rainbow] Who's that?


>
> Hi there,
>
> I wanted introduce myself, as I'm new to the guild, though I've been
> listening in on EQ_rainbow for a really long time. I just joined a couple
> of nights ago. My character is on Rodcet Nife. His name is Txomin, a
dark
> elf enchanter.
>
> What brings me to this server and guild now? Well, I've been playing EQ
> since beta 2, and when final release came around, I burned hard for about
a
> year in it. In that time I moved from Tarew Marr to Tunare, where I
settled
> and founded with a couple of friends one of the biggest and strongest
guilds
> there, named Talisman. I put forth a lot of effort in the guild, and as
the
> leader I encouraged everyone who had problems--in game or real life--to
let
> me know and I'd do everything I could to help. I looked at my position as
> the caretaker of every guildmember's fun; for me I felt I had to ensure
that
> everyone was having a good time. It's a good way to be, and it made the
> guild a terrific place. However, 60+ people all coming to you with their
> problems daily can be a burden after a while. Couple that with a really
> REALLY bad time in my own life and complete burnout was innevitable.
>
> So, around February of this year, I stopped playing. I turned over the
> guild to a really good friend, and it's still going strong. For myself, I
> divorced EQ for about 6 months. I fixed my ailing real life (a year of
> unemployed, continuous EverQuest debauchery can set your existence into a
> tail-spin), got a job and moved to San Diego.
>
> The break presented the perfect opportunity to move to Rodcet Nife and
> finally do what I'd always wished I could have done, and that is join
Mystic
> Alliance. I couldn't leave Tunare before, but now I'm free to do it.
Oddly
> enough, part of the reason I'm playing again is work related. I'm a
content
> writer for Verant Interactive/Sony Online Entertainment now, so it's sort
of
> part of the job!
>
> Anyway, that's my story and I'm sticking to it. As I said, I live in San
> Diego. I'm not sure if anyone else lives here or not. One of the unique
> advantages of my job is, I most likely will be attending some of the
various
> EQ Player get-togethers around the country, particularly the one sponsored
> by Verant. I believe the next one will be February on the East Coast
> somewhere (my old stomping ground), and likely I'll be there. So who
knows,
> I may be in a neighborhood near you in the future :)
>
> Nice to finally be part of something I'd always wished to join in on.
> Thanks!
>
> Clayton Kroh
> "What a piece of work is a man! How noble in reason! how infinite in
> faculty! in form, in moving, how express and admirable! in action how like
> an angel! in apprehension how like a god!"
>
> --from Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, by William Shakespeare
>
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>
>
